terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: STORM Therapeutics Limited Cambridge United Kingdom

description: The field of epitranscriptomics is growing in importance, with chemical modification of RNA being associated with a wide variety of biological phenomena. Mass spectrometry (MS) enables the identification of modified RNA residues within their sequence contexts, by using analogous approaches to shotgun proteomics. We have developed a free and open-source database search engine for RNA MS data, called NucleicAcidSearchEngine (NASE), as part of the OpenMS software framework. NASE allows the reliable identification of (modified) RNA sequences from LC-MS/MS data in a high-throughput fashion. For this validation dataset, we generated a sample of human total tRNA from a cellular extract - a complex mixture of highly modified RNAs. This sample was RNase-treated prior to nanoflow LC-MS/MS analysis.

modifications.name: No PTMs are included in the dataset

title: LC-MS/MS analysis of human cellular tRNA
